pullRequest.body:
This adds
```lean
lemma deriv_comp_neg (f : ùïú ‚Üí F) (a : ùïú) : deriv (fun x ‚Ü¶ f (-x)) a = -deriv f (-a)

/-- A variant of `deriv_const_smul` without differentiability assumption when the scalar
multiplication is by field elements. -/
lemma deriv_const_smul' {f : ùïú ‚Üí F} {x : ùïú} {R : Type*} [Field R] [Module R F] [SMulCommClass ùïú R F]
    [ContinuousConstSMul R F] (c : R) :
    deriv (fun y ‚Ü¶ c ‚Ä¢ f y) x = c ‚Ä¢ deriv f x

lemma iteratedDeriv_neg (n : ‚Ñï) (f : ùïú ‚Üí F) (a : ùïú) :
    iteratedDeriv n (fun x ‚Ü¶ -(f x)) a = -(iteratedDeriv n f a)

lemma iteratedDeriv_comp_neg (n : ‚Ñï) (f : ùïú ‚Üí F) (a : ùïú) :
    iteratedDeriv n (fun x ‚Ü¶ f (-x)) a = (-1 : ùïú) ^ n ‚Ä¢ iteratedDeriv n f (-a)
```
which will come in handy in some future PRs on L-series.

See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/L-series/near/424858837) on Zulip.


---

nodes.body: For the new lemmas on iterated derivatives to work, the file they are in needs to import `deriv_comp_neg`. So I have replaced the imports of `...Deriv.Add` and `...Deriv.Comp` by `...Deriv.Shift` (which adds precisely three lemmas, one of which is the needed one). I hope this is OK.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8171024225/job/22338390109)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8171024225/job/22338390350)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8171024225/job/22338389826)
Is there a lemma `DifferentiableAt ùïú f (-a) \iff DifferentiableAt ùïú (fun x ‚Ü¶ f (-x)) a` hiding here?

```suggestion
    rw [‚Üê Function.comp_def, fderiv.comp _ h differentiable_neg.differentiableAt, coe_comp',
      Function.comp_apply, fderiv_neg, fderiv_id', neg_apply, coe_id', id_eq, map_neg]
```

If you move this lemma to somewhere which imports both `Deriv.Add` and `Deriv.Comp`, then you can golf the proof very substantially:
```suggestion
lemma deriv_comp_neg (f : ùïú ‚Üí F) (a : ùïú) : deriv (fun x ‚Ü¶ f (-x)) a = -deriv f (-a) := by
  by_cases h : DifferentiableAt ùïú f (-a)
  ¬∑ simpa only [deriv_neg, neg_one_smul] using deriv.scomp a h (differentiable_neg _)
  ¬∑ rw [deriv_zero_of_not_differentiableAt h, deriv_zero_of_not_differentiableAt ?_, neg_zero]
    contrapose! h
    convert ((neg_neg a).symm ‚ñ∏ h).comp (-a) (differentiable_neg _)
    ext
    simp only [Function.comp_apply, neg_neg]
```
OK, nice. I've moved the lemma to `Analysis.Calculus.Deriv.Shift`, which has exactly the right imports.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/Calculus/{Iterated}Deriv/*): add lemmas on composition with negation

nodes.body: For the new lemmas on iterated derivatives to work, the file they are in needs to import `deriv_comp_neg`. So I have replaced the imports of `...Deriv.Add` and `...Deriv.Comp` by `...Deriv.Shift` (which adds precisely three lemmas, one of which is the needed one). I hope this is OK.
